We understand that there is a viral video circulating via social media that contains false information about COVID-19 as it relates to student safety. In these uncertain times, we’re disappointed that someone would spread false information for the purpose of getting a viral post. The video claims that there is a NYS law that essentially allows for the government to remove students from schools and detain them if they test positive for COVID-19. This is not accurate.

We have a thorough plan in place (available at phoenixcsd.org/reopening) to address potential positive cases in our district, contact tracing, and quarantine/isolation requirements. None of these plans call for anyone – other than the parent/guardian – to remove a child from a school building for the purposes of detaining them.

We are here to educate and provide safe learning environments for our students, and we take that responsibility seriously. As always, if you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to contact us at 315-695-1555.

Attention seniors: a $500 Pop Warner Scholarship is available! Check out the requirements below and fill out and application: https://www.phoenixcsd.org/Page/4292

1. Must be a senior in high school planning to enroll as a full-time undergraduate study at a College, University or Vocational/Technical school in the Fall directly after graduating high school.

2.Student has completed 4 full seasons as a Pop Warner Football player or Cheerleader, and/or completed two years as a Pop Warner Student Demonstrator, Coach or Volunteer.

3. Have a minimum GPA of 2.5

4. Write an Essay recounting a time when you faced a challenge, setback or failure during your time with Pop Warner. How did it affect you and what did you learn from the experience?
